metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25275 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Dovecot before 2.3.13 has Improper Input Validation in lda, lmtp, and imap, leading to an application crash via a crafted email message with certain choices for ten thousand MIME parts.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25275` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

dovecot-core - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
dovecot-gssapi - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
dovecot-imapd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
dovecot-ldap - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
dovecot-lmtpd - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
dovecot-managesieved - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
dovecot-mysql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
dovecot-pgsql - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
dovecot-pop3d - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
dovecot-sieve - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
dovecot-solr - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
dovecot-sqlite - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
mail-stack-delivery - 1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> per upstream, Vulnerable version: 2.3.11-2.3.11.3 we backported fix to earlier releases, so they are vulnerable

criterions.comment: dovecot package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.2.9-1ubuntu2.6+esm4').
